title: Chief's Blanket, Phase III
text: This exhibition celebrates Din√© artworks that were meant to be worn. Men, women, and children dressed in their finest for special occasions, which included blankets, necklaces and bracelets. Each object was created under the strictest conventions, and encompassed beauty and balance. These traditions continue to be practiced today.
description: geometric design with stripes, double zig-zag bordered diamonds and two-colored squares with stepped centers; white, blue, purple, red, black; irregularity in striped design at central band
creditline: Gift of Robert and Carolyn Nelson
